name: 教育研究論文寫作
goals: 了解論文審查要點與撰寫格式
撰寫教育研究期刊論文
syllabus:
The course schedule will be arranged according to the 16+2 weeks format.

Classroom location: 2nd Meeting Room, 3rd floor, Education Building, Main Campus II (also known as Library Campus)

Week 1 (February 14) Course introduction

Week 2 (February 21) One-to-one meeting (checking the data, research topic, and potential journal)

Week 3 (February 28) (National holiday, No class)

Week 4 (March 7) Tips for writing “Research purposes and questions”/ publication attitude

Week 5 (March 14) One-to-one meeting (Research purposes and questions)

Week 6 (March 21) Tips for writing “Research method”

Week 7 (March 28) Searching literature by using relevant databases

Week 8 (April 04) (National holiday, No class)

Week 9 (April 11) (Midterm, No class) Writing “Research method”

Week 10 (April 18) Tips for writing “Research Results”

Week 11 (April 25) One-to-one meeting (Research Method)/ Self-directed learning assignment I

Week 12 (May 02) Tips for writing “Discussion, conclusion, and implications”

Week 13 (May 09) Tips for writing “Introduction and literature review”

Week 14 (May 16) One-to-one meeting (for Research Results and Discussion)

Week 15 (May 23) Writing a good “Abstract” (30 mins)/ One-to-one meeting (Introduction and literature review)

Week 16 (May 30) Final paper submission (with abstract)/Self-directed learning assignment II

Note 1: For the weeks of one-to-one meeting, please email your writings (either in WORD or PDF format) beforehand.  
Tsai, Chin-Chung: tsaicc@ntnu.edu.tw  
Lin, Tzung-Jin: tzungjinlin@ntnu.edu.tw

Note 2：Each one-to-one meeting schedule will be prioritized for those who formally enrolled this course. For those who only intend to audit this course, they will be arranged when the instructors are available for discussions. Moreover, these auditing students will be given only twice opportunities at top for one-to-one meeting throughout the semester.

methodologies.note: In-class lectures about the tips for writing journal papers
In-class discussions and one-to-one meetings for the ideas of academic writing
Independent writing projects for journal publication

grading.note:
	Self-directed learning assignment I: Search 10 most relevant articles within recent five years and list them in APA style. Each article should have at least 5 sentences for summarizing its main ideas and relations with your own research. (10%)

	Self-directed learning assignment II: Search 5 most relevant journals and understand the scope and aims for each journal. Provide justifications of why each journal is suitable for publishing your own article. Also, search 3 most relevant articles within each journal for the references section. (10%)

	Submit research questions and purposes (10%)

	Submit the part of Research Method (10%)

	Submit the part of Results and Discussion (10%)

	Submit the part of Introduction and literature review(10%)

	Final paper submission (including abstract, main text and references) (20%)

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
